title: Upgrade to latest check style version to support Java 8 syntax features
body:
The current checkstyl version 5.9 is not recognizing method references like this:

`this::doSomething`

Please use the latest version to fix this problem.

title: FindBugsValidator pollute baseDir with findbug_excludes files
body:
FindBugsValidator generates findbug_excludes files on the fly but put them into wrong folder - maven module baseDir.
It's really easy to fix. In `FindBugsValidator.excludes()` change 
`env.basedir().getPath()` 
to
`env.tempdir().getPath()`

title: #408 Fixed NPE in ConstantUsageCheck
body: #408 Fixed NPE in ConstantUsageCheck

title: NPE when using qulice during a build with Maven < 3.2
body:
This has already been reported, but was not considered a bug that is worth fixing: #417 

I insist that this is a bug because it doesn't clearly explain in the log what is the source of the problem.

Qulice should print out something like: "You're using old version of maven, upgrade to 3.2+". 3.0 is a current default in IntelliJ IDEA and it can cause problems to qulice users.

title: Upgrade to FindBugs v3.0.1
body: Currently qulice uses v3.0.0.

title: Is it possible to run qulice for a particular set of files?
body: If I'm working on a single file or a couple of them, then constantly running `mvn qulice:check` for the whole project takes a lot of time. Is it possible to restrict the set of source files being checked?

title: How to disable duplicate dependencies check?
body:
In my `pom.xml` I have following definition:

```
    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>com.qulice</groupId>
                <artifactId>qulice-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.12.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <license>file:${basedir}/LICENSE.txt</license>
                    <exclude>duplicatefinder:com.github.kodapan</exclude>
                    <exclude>dependencies:com.github.kodapan</exclude>
                </configuration>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>check</goal>
                        </goals>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
```

When I run `qulice:check`, the build fails because of these problems:

```
[WARNING] Found duplicate (but equal) classes in [com.github.kodapan:osm-common.core:v0.0.2,se.kodapan.osm.common:core:0.0.2-SNAPSHOT] :
[WARNING]   se.kodapan.lang.Intern
[WARNING]   se.kodapan.osm.domain.OsmObjectVisitor
[WARNING]   se.kodapan.osm.domain.root.AbstractRoot
[WARNING]   se.kodapan.osm.domain.root.Root
```

How can I modify the `exclude` definition above in order for the build to succeed despite these problems (right now, fixing the classpath is out of question) ?

title: overriden ParameterNameCheck
body:
It seems Qulice silently overrides ParameterNameCheck something like this `^[a-z]{3,}$`
Maybe I missed it in the [doc](http://www.qulice.com/quality.html) ?

Is it possible to use default value  `^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$` for [ParameterNameCheck](http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/naming/ParameterNameCheck.html) ?
If yes so what needs to be changed  in the the pom.xml ?

title: NPE charsetName on jslint
body:
For given qulice configuration

```
<plugin>
                        <groupId>com.qulice</groupId>
                        <artifactId>qulice-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                        <version>0.12.1</version>
                        <configuration>
                            <license>file:${basedir}/LICENSE.txt</license>
                            <excludes>
                                <exclude>checkstyle:/src/main/resources/assets/*.*</exclude>
                                <exclude>findbugs:.*</exclude>
                                <exclude>duplicatefinder:.*</exclude>
                                <exclude>dependencies:.*</exclude>
                            </excludes>
                        </configuration>
                        <executions>
                            <execution>
                                <phase>compile</phase>
                                <goals>
                                    <goal>check</goal>
                                </goals>
                            </execution>
                        </executions>
                    </plugin>
```

And given `shop.js` script

```
/*global $, document*/
$(document).ready(function () {
    "use strict";
    $("#buy").click(function () {
        var links = "/shop/";
        $("#buying").find("input").each(function () {
            links = links + $(this).attr("id") + "=" + $(this).val() + "&";
        });
        $("#buying-form").attr("action", links);
        $(this).closest("form").validate();
        $(this).closest("form").submit();
    });
});
```

Here is what I get after `mvn -X clean compile -Pqulice`: 


title: Checkstyle bug: version upgrade
body:
Checkstyle has a bug where WalkTree check fails with NullPointerException.
It is triggered if you have a field such as this in your class (note the lack of `new float[]`)

```
private final float[] FOREGROUND_FRACTIONS =
-    {
-        0.0f,
-        0.03f,
-        0.94f,
-        1.0f
-    };
```

this link suggests it was fixed https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/353
if so, let's upgrade checkstyle.

title: #139 Verify that IndentationCheck bug is not present
body: The `IndentationCheck` bug described was fixed in Checkstyle 5.9. See http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/releasenotes.html and https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/294. I added a test case to show that it is working now.

title: Pack qulice-ant artifact properly
body:
Current version of qulice-ant in http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.qulice/qulice-ant/0.12.1 is not packed with dependencies jars. It's hard to use it with ant because we have to dowload dependencies and define full classpath for qulice-ant manually.
Solution is:
- fix pom.xml problem - add `slf4j-jdk14-1.7.5` dependency. It's necessary to write log to console.
- fix pom.xml problem - set scope=provided for `org.apache.ant:ant:1.9.4`
- qulice-ant jar must be packed with all dependencies jars to deploy in maven central repo
- `qulice-ant/src/site/apt/index.apt.vm` must be updated. We should mention that `com.qulice.ant.QuliceTask` is compatible with ant 1.9. Previous version of ant my be incompatible. Also we should mention where qulice-ant may be downloaded.

title: HeaderCheck for long LICENSE.txt (e.g. GPL)
body:
Dear all,

I just startet using Qulice and ... well I'm learning. ;)

I choosed the GPL license for a personal project via http://choosealicense.com/licenses/gpl-3.0/ and put the whole GPL clauses into my LICENSE.txt file.

Now I don't want to include the whole LICENSE.txt into my java files but only the short version like described at the end of the license:

```
{one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.}
Copyright (C) {year}  {name of author}

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
```

Now the Qulice HeaderCheck is complaining that the header appears to be missing as the files have not anough lines.

Any suggestions?

Thank you and kind regards

title: DependenciesValidator should support excludes
body:
DependenciesValidator should support excludes. For now it can just be totally disabled with

```
<exclude>dependencies:</exclude>
```

It would be really useful to have a possibility to exclude particular artifacts, kind of this way

```
<exclude>dependencies:org.slf4j:slf4j-log4j12, org.aspectj:aspectjrt</exclude>
```

title: URISyntaxException
body:
In `DefaultMavenEnvironment#classLoader` there is a following code:

``` java
    urls.add(
        URI.create(String.format("file:///%s", path)).toURL()
    );
```

It gets executed for each entry in `this,classpath()`. If any entry contains space, this results in `URISyntaxException`. 
A simple example of how this happens here jcabi/jcabi-xml#49 - Windows, maven repo in Documents and Settings folder, maven artifacts in classpath.
Relevant part of the log:

> `Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 19: file://C:/Documents and Settings/JustUser/.m2/reposito
> ry/com/jcabi/jcabi-aspects/0.20.1/jcabi-aspects-0.20.1.jar
>         at java.net.URI.create(URI.java:859)
>         at com.qulice.maven.DefaultMavenEnvironment.classloader(DefaultMavenEnvironment.java:152)
>         at com.qulice.checkstyle.CheckstyleValidator.validate(CheckstyleValidator.java:81)
>         at com.qulice.maven.CheckMojo.run(CheckMojo.java:83)
>         at com.qulice.maven.CheckMojo.doExecute(CheckMojo.java:59)
>         at com.qulice.maven.AbstractQuliceMojo.execute(AbstractQuliceMojo.java:175)
>         at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo(DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:132)
>         ... 20 more
> Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 19: file://C:/Documents and Settings/JustUser/.m2/repository/com/
> jcabi/jcabi-aspects/0.20.1/jcabi-aspects-0.20.1.jar
>         at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2829)
>         at java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:3002)
>         at java.net.URI$Parser.parseHierarchical(URI.java:3086)
>         at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3034)
>         at java.net.URI.(URI.java:595)
>         at java.net.URI.create(URI.java:857)
>         ... 26 more`

Suggested way of fixing it is using `File#toURI` instead of `new URI(String)`.

title: Incomplete documentation: using of proxies
body:
According to #393 qulice is not able to validate xml schemas using proxies which are set up in maven's `settings.xml`. Therefore I would suggest to put this information somewhere in either `README.md` or FAQ or both.

Proxy configuration should be in `MAVEN_OPTS` variable such as:

```
-Dhttp.proxyHost=HOST -Dhttp.proxyPort=PORT
```

title: Checkstyle support in SuppressWarnings annotation
body:
Currently to suppress checkstyle checks `@checkstyle` comment is used. See for example https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-dynamo/issues/8 It is totally not obvious as another checks, say PMD, are suppressed with `@SuppressWarnings` annotation.

Qulice need support to suppress checkstyle checks with `@SuppressWarnings` annotation as well.

title: Windows: lines in file should end with Unix-like end of line
body:
I'm checking out a fresh clone of some repository, say jcabi-dynamo, and running `mvn clean install -Pqulice`. 
Except [failing header checks](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi/issues/297) there is one more issue - hundreds of 

> [ERROR] \src\test\java\com\jcabi\dynamo\AttributesTest.java[30]: Lines in file should end with Unix-like end of line (RegexpMultilineCheck)

The files in repo should be fine, so who is the culprit? Does git somehow change ends of lines? Or does the check itself use system-dependant EOL while it shouldn't in this case?

title: HiddenFieldCheck rule make the code look worse
StrictIndentationCheck
body:
FYI, we removed our own CascadeIndentationCheck in #265

Let's create a new class `StrictIndentationCheck` which will check that every next line is indented by either 1) the same number of spaces as the previous one, or 2) +4 spaces, or 3) -4X spaces, where X is any number.

I have multiple test fails on Windows if there is no `javac` in `PATH`, like this one:

Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "javac": CreateProcess error=2`

Don't think we can do something with it, but at least INSTALL.txt should contain info about `path/to/sdk/bin` must be in `PATH`
